subject: Re: [junit] using junitreport
msgSnippet: ... How did you do it? Can you show us some code? Also bear in mind that there are points in JUnit where it creates a TestResult object internally. My guess is
messageBody:
lukatmyshu wrote:

> For reasons I wont get into, I can't use ant to actually run my tests
> ... but I wanted to use the junitreport task to create the HTML result
> output. When I tried doing it by hand (I generated some sample data
> by plugging an XMLResult object into my TestResult object, then
> running junitreport on that file). What happened, bizarrely enough,
> was my XML file (containing the TestResult data) became empty and I
> got no output.

How did you do it? Can you show us some code?

Also bear in mind that there are points in JUnit where it creates a
TestResult object internally. My guess is that you *think* that you are
substituting your XMLResult object at runtime, but JUnit is ignoring it.
I recommend chasing down that part of the code.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
